sentences.sContent: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.sCn: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.sContent: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.sCn: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.sContent: ...These teams are gaining more power to run their own affairs...
...They can recognize power and know how to use it...
...it symbolizes the rulers’ power and authority...
...powered by anything from solar power to natural gas...
...was put to an end after the nuclear power plant accident inJapan in March...
...The approval of new nuclear power plants was suspended...
...vague figures of power like remote bosses at the mill or clerks at the bank...
...The spread of no-fault divorce has reduced the bargaining power of whichever spouse is more interested in continuing the relationship...
...Premier Gardens is one of a half-dozen subdivisions in California where every home cuts power consumption by 50%...

synos.tran: [物]功率；力量；能力；政权；势力；[数]幂
激励；供以动力；使…有力量

phrases.pCn: adj. 执政的；掌权的；当权的
电网，电力系统；动力系统
发电，发电量；发电机设备
火力；火力发电；热功率；热电站

words.tran: 有动力装置的；以…为动力的
无力的；[劳经] 无能力的，无权的
促进（power的过去分词）；给…提供动力

trans.tranOther: the ability or right to control people or events
